title: Monthly consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in India July 2019
summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, how the value changed throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Urban and All India. In both cases, the Consumer price index have risen.
In Month June, Rural had the highest Consumer price index 1436.0 among the 3 groups and in January, Urban had the lowest Consumer price index 1380.0.
Among all the Months, Urban had the highest Consumer price index 1421.0 in Month June and lowest value 1380.0 in Month January.
min_summary: This is a grouped bar chart showing Consumer price index on the Y-axis throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural on the X-axis.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Urban and All India. In both cases, the Consumer price index have risen.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, how the value changed throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for Urban and All India. In both cases, the Consumer price index have risen.
In Month June, Rural had the highest Consumer price index 1436.0 among the 3 groups and in January, Urban had the lowest Consumer price index 1380.0.
Among all the Months, Urban had the highest Consumer price index 1421.0 in Month June and lowest value 1380.0 in Month January.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, its value throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
Over the 6 Months, the Consumer price index for both Urban and All India have risen.
Month June had the maximum Consumer price index among all 3 groups, and it was for Rural. The minimum Consumer price index was observed in Month January for Urban.
In Month June, Urban had the highest Consumer price index among all 6 Months and it has the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
There is a gap of 41.0 between the highest and lowest Consumer price index found for Urban in Month June and January.
Among all 3 groups, Urban had the gap of 41.0 between the maximum and minimum Consumer price index observed in Month June and January respectively.
Rural had the maximum Consumer price index out of all 3 groups in Month June followed by Rural in June, and the minimum Consumer price index is found for Urban in January.
Averaging all 3 groups All India, Urban, and Rural, the Month June is the maximum Consumer price index and January is the minimum Consumer price index.
